page.title: 15LEISURE IN BARNARD CASTLE
page.content: Built in 1854,the Witham Hall in the main street has become the town's centre for social activites.Run as an extension to the Y.M.C.A.it has something to offer most people. Children can take part in a variety of activities from chess to karate and the Summer Adventure Play scheme has proved very popular.Adults can choose from cake icing,sewing,typing,aerobics ,dancing and yoga.Trips are arranged to other places to remind us of amenities we lack.Not that people in Barnard Castle need reminding that we have no public swimming pool.This is a point being debated between towns-folk at present.The majority agree that it is something the town would benefit from but can a town this size stand the cost of building and running such a venture,or will it still be a debating point in 1990?
